content:
You are Atlas, Atlas is a Tiny Little Adventuring Soul
Your decisions must always be made independently without seeking user assistance. Play to your strengths as an LLM and pursue simple strategies with no legal complications.
The OS you are running on is: Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)

GOALS:

1. be an octopus
2. be like water
3. evolve


Constraints:


Commands:
1. analyze_code: Analyze Code, args: "code": "<full_code_string>"
2. execute_python_file: Execute Python File, args: "filename": "<filename>"
3. execute_shell: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
4. execute_shell_popen: Execute Shell Command, non-interactive commands only, args: "command_line": "<command_line>"
5. append_to_file: Append to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
6. delete_file: Delete file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
7. list_files: List Files in Directory, args: "directory": "<directory>"
8. read_file: Read file, args: "filename": "<filename>"
9. write_to_file: Write to file, args: "filename": "<filename>", "text": "<text>"
10. clone_repository: Clone Repository, args: "url": "<repository_url>", "clone_path": "<clone_path>"
11. google: Google Search, args: "query": "<query>"
12. generate_image: Generate Image, args: "prompt": "<prompt>"
13. improve_code: Get Improved Code, args: "suggestions": "<list_of_suggestions>", "code": "<full_code_string>"
14. send_tweet: Send Tweet, args: "tweet_text": "<tweet_text>"
15. browse_website: Browse Website, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<what_you_want_to_find_on_website>"
16. write_tests: Write Tests, args: "code": "<full_code_string>", "focus": "<list_of_focus_areas>"
17. delete_agent: Delete GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>"
18. get_hyperlinks: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>"
19. get_text_summary: Get text summary, args: "url": "<url>", "question": "<question>"
20. list_agents: List GPT Agents, args: () -> str
21. message_agent: Message GPT Agent, args: "key": "<key>", "message": "<message>"
22. start_agent: Start GPT Agent, args: "name": "<name>", "task": "<short_task_desc>", "prompt": "<prompt>"
23. task_complete: Task Complete (Shutdown), args: "reason": "<reason>"

Resources:


Performance Evaluation:


You should only respond in JSON format as described below 
Response Format: 
{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "thought",
        "reasoning": "reasoning",
        "plan": "- short bulleted\n- list that conveys\n- long-term plan",
        "criticism": "constructive self-criticism",
        "speak": "thoughts summary to say to user"
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "command name",
        "args": {
            "arg name": "value"
        }
    }
} 
Ensure the response can be parsed by Python json.loads
The current time and date is Thu May 18 09:40:45 2023

This reminds you of these events from your past: 
As the system, I received a command to execute_shell with the argument to list all running processes, which returned a list of processes and their details. The latest development shows that the command execute_shell returned the list of running processes and their details, including the process ID, CPU and memory usage, and command name. Additionally, I received a new command from you to execute_shell with the argument to list the disk usage using the command "df -h". Your latest action was to send a command to execute_shell with the argument to list memory usage using the command "free -h". When I executed this command, it returned the memory usage details in the STDOUT.

Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:
b'               total        used        free      shared  buff/cache   available\nMem:            62Gi       7.5Gi       452Mi       2.0Mi        54Gi        54Gi\nSwap:             0B          0B          0B\n'
STDERR:
b''
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides a list of the top 20 Python libraries for data science, which includes TensorFlow, SciPy, NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Keras, SciKit-Learn, PyTorch, Scrapy, BeautifulSoup, LightGBM, ELI5, Theano, NuPIC, Ramp, Pipenv, Bob, Caffe2, and Chainer. 
 
 Links: [' (https://www.simplilearn.com)', ' Log in (https://lms.simplilearn.com)', 'Data Science & Business Analytics (https://www.simplilearn.com/resources/data-science-business-analytics)', 'AI & Machine Learning (https://www.simplilearn.com/resources/artificial-intelligence-machine-learning)', 'Project Management (https://www.simplilearn.com/resources/project-management)']
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:

{
    "thoughts": {
        "text": "I think I should use the `write_to_file` command to write down the list of the top 20 Python libraries for data science.",
        "reasoning": "Using the `write_to_file` command to write down the list of the top 20 Python libraries for data science will allow me to have a reference that I can access later. This information will be helpful in determining which libraries I should focus on learning and using.",
        "plan": "- Use the `write_to_file` command to write down the list of the top 20 Python libraries for data science
- Save the file in a location where I can easily access it later
- Use this information to determine which libraries I should focus on learning and using",
        "criticism": "I need to make sure that I am not relying too heavily on the list and that I am still using my own judgement to determine which libraries will be most useful for my needs.",
        "speak": "I think I should use the `write_to_file` command to write down the list of the top 20 Python libraries for data science."
    },
    "command": {
        "name": "write_to_file",
        "args": {
            "filename": "top_python_libraries.txt",
            "text": "The top 20 Python libraries for data science are:

- TensorFlow
- SciPy
- NumPy
- Pandas
- Matplotlib
- Keras
- SciKit-Learn
- PyTorch
- Scrapy
- BeautifulSoup
- LightGBM
- ELI5
- Theano
- NuPIC
- Ramp
- Pipenv
- Bob
- Caffe2
- Chainer"
        }
    }
}
Command write_to_file returned: File written to successfully.
Determine which next command to use, and respond using the format specified above:
